title: Single-product shirt storefront with Cash App instruction modal

requirements.summary: Implement a single, visible product storefront page for one shirt priced at $25 with a primary “Buy Now” CTA.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a single visible product page (no additional pages required).
The page clearly displays the product price as "$25".
The page includes a primary call-to-action button labeled "Buy Now".

file_operations.description: Create the single-page storefront UI (product title/description area, price "$25", and primary "Buy Now" button) with a responsive layout (no additional routes/pages).

requirements.summary: Add the two uploaded shirt images as static assets and present them as front/back product photos on the product page.
acceptanceCriteria: Both uploaded images (Photoroom_20260118_154454.jpeg and Photoroom_20260118_154454-1.jpeg) are included as static frontend assets and render on the product page.
Users can view both images as front/back product photos (e.g., gallery, carousel, or selectable thumbnails).
No visual edits are applied to the images (cropping/resizing for layout is allowed, but the image content must not be altered).

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded front-view product image as a static public asset (ensure content is unchanged; only rendered sizing is allowed).
Add the uploaded back-view product image as a static public asset (ensure content is unchanged; only rendered sizing is allowed).
Wire the two static images into the product page as a simple front/back gallery (e.g., selectable thumbnails that swap the main image) and ensure both render clearly on mobile and desktop.

requirements.summary: Implement a “Buy Now” modal popup with manual Cash App instructions to send $25 to $bslimeballin and a post-payment fulfillment note.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "Buy Now" button opens a modal (not a separate page).
The modal text instructs the user to send exactly $25 to Cash App cashtag "$bslimeballin".
The modal includes a clear note that the product will be sent after payment is received.
The modal provides a close action (e.g., X button and/or Close button) and can be dismissed via Escape key.
No claim is made that the app performs direct Cash App payment processing.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable modal component that renders manual payment instructions (send exactly "$25" to Cash App cashtag "$bslimeballin"), includes an explicit note that the product ships after payment is received, and supports close controls plus Escape-key dismissal (no claims of direct Cash App processing).
Connect the "Buy Now" button to open the CashAppInstructionsModal, manage open/close state, and ensure the modal is an overlay popup rather than a new page.

requirements.summary: Apply a distinctive streetwear theme with consistent palette, typography, spacing, and responsive behavior across the page and modal (avoid default gradient look).
acceptanceCriteria: The product page and modal share a consistent visual style (colors, type scale, button styling).
The theme does not rely on a blue/purple gradient default aesthetic.
The layout is responsive and remains usable on mobile widths.

file_operations.description: Create global styles to establish the streetwear theme (consistent color palette, typography scale, spacing, and button/overlay basics), explicitly avoiding a blue/purple gradient default aesthetic; ensure mobile-friendly base styling.
Align layout and UI styling with the global theme (type scale, spacing rhythm, button styling) and ensure responsive behavior for the product gallery and modal content on narrow screens.
Apply the same theme tokens/styles used by the product page to the modal (overlay, card surface, typography, and buttons) so both feel cohesive and distinctive.
